description: Demolition of existing warehouse building and redevelopment for the erection of a  mixed use scheme comprising 4 dwellinghouses (Class C3) and offices (Class B1a)
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - The details of the external facing materials to be used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 3 - The development shall not be occupied until the whole of the car parking provision shown on the approved drawings is provided. Thereafter the whole of the car parking provision shall be retained and used for no purpose other than for the parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the residential units.

Reason: To ensure that the use of the premises does not add to parking pressures in surrounding streets which would be contrary to policies RE2 and TR17 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 4 - The second and third floor windows facing south in the office component of the building hereby approved must be obscure glazed and non-opening to a height of 1.6m above each floor level and must be retained and maintained in this state for as long as the development remains in existance.

Reason: In order to prevent unreasonable overlooking of neighbouring premises in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN1 and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 5 - Details of a cycle storage for the office use at least 1 cycle parking space to be accessible to staff of the B1 component of the scheme shall be submitted to and approved by Council prior to the commencement of work.  The storage facility shall be constructed prior to the commencement of the use and thereafter maintained. 

Reason: In order to comply with the requirements of Policy DS8 (Car parking, servicing, taxi, coach and cycle parking standards) of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 6 - No development shall take place until full details of hard and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all un-built, open areas have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 7 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details prior to the occupation for the permitted use of the development or any phase of the development.   Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 8 - The use hereby permitted shall not begin until full details of the scheme for the ventilation of the premises to an adequate outlet level, including details of sound attenuation for any necessary plant have been submitted to and approved by the Council and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any approval given.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the residential units within the premiess, those of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6, DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 9 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 10 - No development shall take place until:
a)	The applicant has submitted a programme of ground investigation for the presence of soil and groundwater contamination and landfill gas for approval by the Council; and
b)	The investigation has been carried out in accordance with the approved details and the results and remediation measures (if necessary) have been submitted to and approved by the Council. All approved remediation measures shall be implemented strictly in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To protect future occupiers of the development from the possible presence of ground contamination arising in connection with the previous industrial/storage use of the site in accordance with policy EN10 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 11 - The acoustic insulation measures along the north boundary of the building shall be of a standard to provide adequate sound insulation to the residential units hereby approved.

Reason: In order to prevent unreasonable disturbance to the future occupiers of the residential units from the adjoining railway line in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 12 - Notwithstanding Drawing No. A13RevC planning permission is not granted for the new entrance gates.  Details of any alterations to the front entrance gates must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason:  To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
ward: Camden Town with Primrose Hill (Pre May 2022)
